page.title: 10EAST KILBRIDE_HUNTER MUSEUM
page.content: EAST KILBRIDE--HUNTER MUSEUM The Hunter House Museum,where William and John Hunter were born,is in Calder wood. The Hunter Health Centre and the Hunter schools are named after the famous brothers. William attended the village school and went to Hamilton and studied under Doctor Gullen. When in London he studied midwifery and anatomy and founded medical school where many students,including his brother were taught.William Hunter became Queen Charlotte's physician. With little education,John went to LONDON to study under his brother. John became famous because he was the first person to disect bodies.He was also the first person to perform a transplant-he transplanted teeth. John is now buried in WESTMINSTER ABBEY.
